questionText: You can use a cell phone while driving only
answerB: When you're alone in the car
answerC: When the phone is in hands-free mode and only when necessary
explanation: Adult drivers should only use a cell phone in hands-free mode when necessary. Driving while using a handheld cell phone is unsafe and illegal.

questionText: What should you do when approaching a crosswalk and pedestrians are present?
answerA: Speed up to get past them quickly
answerC: Stop at the limit line and wait until they have crossed
answerD: Honk your horn to alert them
explanation: When there is a pedestrian crossing a roadway, you must use caution, reduce your speed, or stop to allow the pedestrian to safely finish crossing. If there is a limit line before the crosswalk, stop at the limit line.

questionText: When are you allowed to pass a vehicle on the right?
answerB: When the vehicle ahead is making a left turn, and you do not drive off the roadway
answerC: When the vehicle ahead is going too slow
explanation: You may pass on the right only when the driver ahead of you is turning left and you can safely pass on the right. Never drive off the paved or main-traveled part of the road to pass.

questionText: What does a flashing red traffic light mean?
answerA: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and proceed when it's safe
answerC: Stop and do not proceed until the light is green
explanation: A flashing red signal light means STOP. After stopping, you may go when it is safe. Treat it like a stop sign.

questionText: When should you use your headlights?
answerB: In adverse weather, such as rain, snow, or fog
explanation: Use your headlights beginning 30 minutes after sunset until 30 minutes before sunrise, in adverse weather, on mountain roads and tunnels, and when conditions prevent you from seeing other vehicles.

questionText: What should you do if you are involved in a collision?
answerA: Leave the scene if you are not injured
answerB: Move your vehicle off of the roadway (if it is safe to do so)
answerC: Argue with the other driver about who is at fault
answerD: Wait for the police to arrive before you exchange information
explanation: Move your vehicle out of traffic if no one is hurt. Call 911 right away if anyone is hurt. Moving vehicles off the road helps prevent further accidents.

questionText: The speed limit in a residential area, unless otherwise posted, is:
explanation: The speed limit in business or residential districts is 25 mph, unless otherwise posted.

questionText: When making a right turn, you should:
answerB: Yield to pedestrians who are crossing the street
answerC: Check for traffic and give the right-of-way to approaching vehicles
explanation: When making a right turn, signal about 100 feet before the turn, watch for pedestrians and bicyclists, look both ways, and turn when it is safe.

questionText: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign indicate?
explanation: A diamond-shaped sign warns you of specific road conditions and dangers ahead.

questionText: If you see a solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line, this means that:
answerA: Vehicles on both sides can pass when safe
answerB: Vehicles next to the broken line can pass when safe
answerC: Vehicles next to the solid line can pass when safe
explanation: A broken yellow line indicates you may pass if the broken line is next to your driving lane. You may not pass if there is a solid yellow line on your side.

questionText: You are approaching a school bus that has stopped with red lights flashing. What should you do?
answerA: Pass the bus before any kids get off
answerB: Stop and wait until the red lights stop flashing
answerC: Honk your horn to alert the driver
answerD: Speed up to pass the bus quickly
explanation: When the bus flashes red lights, you must stop from either direction until the children are safely across the street and the lights stop flashing. Remain stopped while the red lights are flashing.

questionText: When you sell a vehicle, you need to notify the DMV within _____ days.
explanation: When you sell a vehicle, you must notify DMV within five days by completing a Notice of Transfer and Release of Liability.

questionText: When can you make a left turn at a red light?
answerB: From a one-way street onto another one-way street
answerC: Whenever there's a safe break in traffic
answerD: When you're the only one at the stop light
explanation: You may turn left against a red light when you are turning from a one-way street onto a one-way street. Make sure there is no sign prohibiting the turn and yield to other vehicles and pedestrians.

questionText: What should you do if your vehicle starts to hydroplane?
answerB: Turn the steering wheel back and forth
answerC: Ease off the gas pedal and slow gradually
answerD: Apply the brakes quickly and hard
explanation: If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, slow down gradually. Do not use the brakes as sudden braking may cause you to lose control of your vehicle.

questionText: When should you use your high-beam headlights?
answerB: When driving on open country roads or dark city streets with no other surrounding vehicles
answerC: On city streets in busy traffic
explanation: When driving at night, use your high-beam headlights on open country roads or dark city streets. Dim your high-beam headlights to low beams within 500 feet of a vehicle coming toward you or within 300 feet of a vehicle you are following.

questionText: Sometimes roads are more slippery:
answerA: On interstates with lots of large vehicle traffic
answerB: On bridges or overpasses as they tend to freeze first
answerC: In areas that receive lots of sunlight
explanation: Bridges and overpasses tend to freeze before the rest of the road. They can have icy spots and are more slippery in cold weather.

questionText: You should signal your intention to turn or change lanes:
answerA: At least 100 feet before the turn or lane change
answerB: At least 200 feet before the turn or lane change
answerC: At least 50 feet before the turn or lane change
explanation: You should signal at least 100 feet before you turn or change lanes on city streets, and at least five seconds before you change lanes on a freeway.

questionText: What does a 'No U-Turn' sign mean?
answerA: U-turns are allowed at all times
answerB: U-turns are allowed during certain times of the day
answerD: U-turns are only allowed at night
explanation: Never make a U-turn where a NO U-TURN sign is posted. The sign prohibits U-turns at all times.

questionText: What should you do if an emergency vehicle with lights and sirens is approaching?
answerA: Speed up to get out of the way
answerB: Pull over to the right and stop
answerC: Stop in the middle of the road
answerD: Continue driving at the same speed
explanation: Give the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle using a siren and red lights. Drive to the right edge of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed.

questionText: Where should you stop your vehicle when there is no limit line?
answerC: Before entering the crosswalk or intersection
answerD: You do not need to stop if there's no limit line
explanation: If there is no limit line, stop before you enter the crosswalk. If there is no crosswalk, stop before you enter the intersection.

questionText: If you are involved in a traffic accident, you should:
answerA: Quickly follow and pursue the other driver
answerB: Wait for the other driver to return
answerC: Leave the scene and go home
answerD: Call 911 right away if anyone is hurt
explanation: Call 911 right away if anyone is hurt in a collision. You must stop and someone could be injured and need your help.

questionText: If your car starts to skid, you should:
answerA: Brake hard and steer in the opposite direction of the skid
answerB: Steer in the direction you want to go and ease off the gas
answerD: Close your eyes and hope for the best
explanation: If you start to skid, slowly remove your foot from the accelerator, do not use the brakes, and turn the steering wheel in the direction of the skid. Try to get a wheel on dry pavement.

questionText: When can you drive in a bike lane?
answerB: When you are within 200 feet of a corner and preparing to turn right
answerC: When passing heavy traffic and there are no bicyclists in the bike lane
answerD: Vehicles are always able to use the bike lane
explanation: It is illegal to drive in a bicycle lane unless you are parking (where permitted), entering or leaving the road, or turning within 200 feet of an intersection.

questionText: When you see livestock near the roadway, you should:
answerD: Slow down and follow directions from the person in charge
explanation: If you see animals or livestock near the road, slow down or stop and proceed when it is safe. Be sure to follow directions from the person in charge of the animals.

questionText: When you park uphill on a street with a curb, you should:
answerA: Turn your wheels towards the curb (to the right)
answerB: Turn your wheels away from the curb (to the left)
explanation: When parking uphill, turn your front wheels away from the curb (left toward the center of the road) and let your vehicle roll back a few inches so the wheel gently touches the curb.

questionText: When you are approaching a 'Yield' sign, you should:
answerA: Treat it like a stop sign and come to a complete stop
answerB: Slow down and yield the right-of-way to pedestrians or other vehicles
answerC: Honk to let other drivers know you're entering the intersection
explanation: Slow down and be ready to stop to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed

questionText: When you see a flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection, you should:
answerB: Speed up to clear the intersection quickly
answerC: Slow down and proceed with caution
explanation: A flashing yellow traffic signal light is a warning to proceed with caution. Slow down and be alert

questionText: At an intersection with a stop sign on all four corners, you should:
answerA: Proceed through the intersection without stopping if you're the only vehicle
answerB: Stop and proceed when it is your turn
answerC: Wait for all other vehicles to clear the intersection
answerD: Wait for a driver to wave you through
explanation: The vehicle that arrives to the intersection first has the right-of-way. If vehicles arrive at the same time, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way

questionText: What should you do if you are being tailgated?
answerA: Increase your speed to put distance between you and the other driver
answerB: Brake suddenly to make the other driver back off
answerC: Maintain your speed and allow the driver to pass when safe
answerD: Slow down gradually or pull over to allow the tailgater to pass
explanation: Maintain your course and speed. Then, when safe to do so, merge right to change into another lane and allow the tailgater to pass

questionText: It is illegal to drive a vehicle with a blood alcohol concentration of ___ or higher.
explanation: It is illegal to drive with a BAC of 0.08% or higher if you are over 21 years old

questionText: You are driving on a two-lane road. An oncoming vehicle has its high beams on. You should:
answerC: Look to the right edge of your lane
answerD: Stop in the middle of the road until the other vehicle passes
explanation: Do not look directly into the oncoming headlights. Look toward the right edge of your lane and watch the oncoming vehicle out of the corner of your eye

questionText: What do double solid white lines indicate?
answerA: You are allowed to change lanes
answerB: You are not allowed to change lanes
answerC: That lane is about to end
explanation: Double solid white lines indicate a lane barrier between a regular use and a preferential use lane. Never change lanes over double solid white lines

questionText: When driving in heavy fog, you should use your:
explanation: Use your low-beam headlights in heavy fog. High-beam headlights will reflect back and cause glare

questionText: Symptoms of carbon monoxide poisoning may include:
explanation: Symptoms of carbon monoxide poisoning include tiredness, yawning, dizziness, nausea, headache, and ringing in the ears

questionText: When can you cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle?
answerA: When the vehicle in front of you is moving below the speed limit
answerB: When you are in a hurry
answerC: When there is no oncoming traffic
answerD: You are not allowed to cross a double yellow line to pass
explanation: Do not pass over double solid yellow lines. You may only cross them to turn left into a driveway or make a U-turn, not to pass vehicles

questionText: If you are involved in an accident, and your vehicle is blocking traffic, you should:
answerB: Move it out of the way if possible
answerC: Wait for the police to arrive before moving it
answerD: Abandon the vehicle and find a safe place to wait
explanation: Move your vehicle out of traffic if no one is hurt. This helps prevent additional collisions

questionText: An intersection is:
answerA: Any roadway that has signal lights
answerC: Any place where one road meets another road
explanation: An intersection is any place where one road meets another road

questionText: When should you not make a U-turn?
answerA: On a curve or near a hill where visibility is limited
answerB: At an intersection where there is a 'No U-Turn' sign
explanation: Never make a U-turn where a NO U-TURN sign is posted, on a curve or hill where you cannot see clearly for 200 feet in each direction, at railroad crossings, or on divided highways by crossing a dividing section

questionText: If you approach an intersection at the same time as another vehicle, who has the right-of-way?
answerD: The vehicle that is moving faster
explanation: If a vehicle, pedestrian, or bicyclist gets to the intersection at the same time as you, give the right-of-way to the vehicle, pedestrian, or bicyclist on your right

questionText: When driving near large vehicles or trucks, you should:
answerA: Avoid changing lanes directly in front of them
answerB: Drive right next to them so they know you're there
answerC: Trust that they can stop quickly and with ease
explanation: Do not change lanes directly in front of large vehicles. Large vehicles and commercial trucks take longer to stop than passenger vehicles

questionText: When is it legal to use the carpool lane?
answerA: When you have the minimum number of passengers as posted
answerC: When you are late and need to get somewhere quickly
answerD: Whenever you want to pass other vehicles
explanation: You can use an HOV carpool lane when you have the minimum number of people posted on signs at the on-ramp or along the road

questionText: If you see a blind person with a white cane at a crosswalk, you should:
answerA: Honk your horn to let them know you are there
answerC: Stop and give them the right-of-way
answerD: Tell them to wait until you pass
explanation: Pedestrians using guide dogs or white canes have the right-of-way at all times. Do not honk your horn at a blind person

questionText: If you're driving in a city with light rails, you should:
answerA: Be aware that buildings could cause blind spots for rail operators
answerB: Check for approaching rails before crossing tracks
explanation: When driving near light rail vehicles, be aware of blind spots, check for approaching rails before crossing tracks, and maintain a safe distance

questionText: What is the minimum following distance you should maintain under normal driving conditions?
explanation: Use the three-second rule to ensure a safe following distance. When the vehicle in front of you passes a certain point, count three seconds. If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely

questionText: In California, what is the blood alcohol concentration (BAC) limit for drivers on DUI probation?
answerD: Any amount of alcohol 0.01% or higher is illegal
explanation: It is illegal to drive with a BAC of 0.01% or higher at any age if you are on DUI probation

questionText: What should you do if a law enforcement officer is pulling you over?
answerA: Speed up to find a safe place to stop
answerB: Stop in the lane you are in
answerC: Slowly and safely pull over to the right side of the road
answerD: Signal and drive to the nearest off-ramp
explanation: Turn on your right turn signal to acknowledge the officer. Move completely onto the right shoulder and stop in a well-lit area when possible

questionText: If you experience a tire blowout while driving on the road, you should:
answerA: Continue driving to the nearest rest stop or gas station
answerB: Immediately stop in the middle of the road with your emergency flashers on
answerC: Wave to nearby vehicles to call 911
answerD: Gradually release the brake, turn on emergency flashers, and pull over to the side of the road
explanation: Hold the steering wheel with both hands, maintain your speed if possible, gradually release the accelerator, correct the steering to stabilize your vehicle, and once stabilized, continue to slow down and pull off the road where it's safe

questionText: When should you use your horn?
answerA: When another driver makes a mistake
answerB: To scold a driver who has annoyed you
answerC: When you are lost and need directions
answerD: To alert others to a dangerous situation
explanation: Use your horn to avoid collisions and alert oncoming traffic on narrow mountain roads where you cannot see at least 200 feet ahead

questionText: What should you do if your accelerator sticks and you cannot get it to release?
answerA: Pump the accelerator to try to release it
answerB: Shift into neutral and use the brakes to slow down
answerD: Try to drive to the nearest service station
explanation: Shift into neutral to disengage the engine from the wheels, then use the brakes to slow down and pull safely off the road

questionText: What is the proper procedure for changing lanes?
answerA: Check your rearview and side mirrors, and then change lanes
answerB: Signal, check your mirrors, check your blind spot, and then change lanes when it is safe
answerD: Honk your horn and change lanes quickly
explanation: Before changing lanes: signal, check your mirrors, check traffic behind and beside you, look over your shoulder to check your blind spots, and be sure there is enough space for your vehicle in the next lane

questionText: When you approach a roundabout, you should:
explanation: In roundabouts, you must yield to all traffic already in the roundabout, including pedestrians and bicyclists. Traffic travels in a counterclockwise direction around the central island.

questionText: When driving in the rain, you should:
answerA: Turn on your low-beam headlights and increase your following distance.
answerB: Drive in the middle of the road to avoid standing water.
answerC: Increase your speed to get through the rain quickly.
explanation: When it is raining, you must turn on your low-beam headlights and windshield wipers. You should also increase your following distance to maintain a safe stopping distance on wet roads.

questionText: You should use your turn signals:
answerA: Only when other vehicles are present.
answerB: Whenever you change lanes or plan to turn.
answerC: Only when you feel it's necessary.
explanation: You must signal at least 100 feet before you turn, before every lane change, and even when you do not see other vehicles around you. Turn signals communicate your intentions to other road users.

questionText: Driving without insurance is okay as long as:
answerA: You plan to get your vehicle insured within 30 days.
answerB: You've had insurance at some point in the last 5 years.
answerC: Your insurance expired within the last 3 months.
answerD: It is never legal to drive without insurance.
explanation: California law requires all drivers to have proof of financial responsibility (insurance) when driving. Your driving privilege will be suspended for up to four years if you are in a collision and do not have proper insurance coverage.

questionText: When you are in a dedicated turn lane controlled by a green arrow, which of the following is true?
answerA: All oncoming vehicles and pedestrians are stopped by red lights.
answerB: You may turn in the direction the arrow is pointing.
explanation: A green arrow means you may make a protected turn in the direction the arrow is pointing. Oncoming vehicles are stopped by a red traffic signal light, allowing you to turn safely.

questionText: If a traffic light is not working, you should:
answerA: Flash your high beams at oncoming traffic.
answerB: Drive through the intersection and honk your horn.
answerC: Come to a complete stop and treat the intersection as an all-way stop.
answerD: Stop at the intersection and wait until someone comes to fix the light.
explanation: When a traffic light is not working, you must stop as if the intersection is controlled by STOP signs in all directions. Then proceed cautiously when it is safe to do so.

questionText: A flashing red traffic signal at an intersection has the same requirements as which of the following?
explanation: A flashing red signal light means STOP. After stopping, you may go when it is safe, just like at a stop sign.

questionText: Seat belts are required:
answerA: For all passengers in a vehicle.
answerB: Only the driver of the vehicle.
answerC: Only the driver and children under the age of 8.
answerD: Only children under the age of 8.
explanation: California law requires that you and all passengers in your vehicle wear seat belts. You can get a ticket if anyone in your vehicle is not wearing a seat belt.

questionText: Fines are _____ in highway construction when workers are present.
explanation: Fines are doubled in highway construction or maintenance zones when workers are present to ensure worker safety.

questionText: If you see a hazard or car accident ahead of you, which method can you use to warn vehicles behind you?
answerA: Shout out your window to nearby vehicles.
answerB: Tap on your brake lightly to flash your brake lights.
explanation: Tapping your brakes lightly causes your brake lights to flash, warning drivers behind you of a hazard ahead. This gives them time to slow down safely.

questionText: If you are stopped at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
answerA: Go as soon as the train has passed.
answerB: Wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
answerC: Go when the rail signal lights stop flashing and the view is clear.
answerD: Go when other vehicles begin to move.
explanation: Many crossings have multiple tracks. Do not proceed over the railroad tracks until the flashing red warning lights stop flashing, even if the gate rises. Look in both directions and only cross when it is safe.

questionText: When you see a 'School Zone' sign, you should:
answerB: Speed up to clear the area quickly.
answerC: Slow down, prepare to stop, and watch for children.
answerD: Honk your horn to alert students of your presence.
explanation: The speed limit is 25 mph within 500 feet of a school while children are outside or crossing the street. Some school zones may have speed limits as low as 15 mph. Always watch for children, bicyclists, pedestrians, and school safety patrols.

questionText: You are permitted to turn right against a red light as long as:
answerA: There are no signs reading 'No Turn on Red'.
answerB: You stop, check for traffic, and proceed when clear.
answerD: You are never permitted to turn against a red light.
explanation: You may turn right at a red light after making a complete stop at the stop or limit line if there is not a NO TURN ON RED sign posted. You must yield for pedestrians and turn when it is safe.

questionText: When exiting a highway, you should:
answerA: Signal at least five seconds before exiting.
answerB: Switch lanes at the last minute to make sure you don't miss your exit.
answerC: Cross over solid white lines if it gets you to your exit lane faster.
explanation: When in the proper lane, signal five seconds (approximately 400 feet) before you exit. Know your exit and be aware of when it is approaching to allow time for safe lane changes.

questionText: When parking your vehicle parallel to the curb on a level street:
answerA: Your front wheels must be turned towards the street.
answerB: Your wheels must be within 18 inches of the curb.
answerC: One of your rear wheels must touch the curb.
answerD: Your front wheels must be turned towards the sidewalk.
explanation: When parallel parking, your vehicle should be parallel and within 18 inches of the curb.

questionText: You may legally park in front of a driveway:
answerA: If the driveway is in the front of your house.
answerB: If the driveway is in the front of an apartment building.
answerC: As long as it is not for longer than 15 minutes.
explanation: Never park or leave your vehicle on a sidewalk, partially blocking a sidewalk, or in front of a driveway. Blocking any driveway is illegal.

questionText: When using a center turn lane to make a left turn, you can only drive in the center lane for ____ before turning.
explanation: You may enter a two-way center left turn lane within 200 feet of the turn. You must respect the right-of-way of any vehicle, bicyclist, or motorcyclist already in the lane.

questionText: If you approach a solid white line of triangles at an intersection, what should you do?
answerC: Continue driving at the same speed.
explanation: A yield line is a line of solid white triangles that shows approaching vehicles where to yield or stop. The triangles point towards approaching vehicles.

questionText: When you are merging onto the highway, you should be driving:
answerA: At or near the same speed as the freeway traffic.
answerB: More slowly than the freeway traffic.
explanation: When you enter a highway, you need to be at or near the speed of traffic. Merge into highway traffic when safe to do so without stopping unless absolutely necessary.

questionText: If you are involved in a collision, you must exchange with the other person(s) involved your driver's license information and:
explanation: If you are in a collision, you must show your driver's license, vehicle registration card, insurance information, and current address to the other driver, law enforcement officer, and anyone else involved in the collision.

questionText: When can you park in a crosshatched area next to disabled parking spaces?
answerA: Any time, if you're only going to be a few minutes.
answerB: If you have a disabled person parking placard or plates.
answerC: When all other spaces are taken.
explanation: Never park or leave your vehicle in the crosshatched (diagonal lines) area next to a designated disabled parking space. These are access aisles needed by people with disabilities.

questionText: What is the maximum speed limit on a two-lane undivided highway?
answerD: There is no maximum speed limit.
explanation: Unless otherwise posted, the maximum speed limit is 55 mph on a two-lane undivided highway and for vehicles towing trailers.

questionText: If you buy a vehicle out-of-state, you have _____ days to register the vehicle in California.
explanation: You have 20 days to register your vehicle after you become a resident or get a job in California.

questionText: Children who are ____ need to be in a rear-facing child passenger seat.
explanation: Children who are under 2 years old, under 40 pounds, AND under 3 feet 4 inches tall must be secured in a rear-facing child passenger restraint system.

questionText: When should you yield your legal right-of-way?
answerC: Only when the other driver lets you.
answerD: Only when you are in a hurry.
explanation: Never assume that other drivers will give you the right-of-way. Give up your right-of-way when it will help prevent collisions.

questionText: In a roundabout:
answerA: If you miss your exit, stop and reverse.
answerB: Take whichever exit is closest to you.
answerC: Yield to all traffic already in the roundabout.
answerD: You don't need to use your turn signal.
explanation: You must yield to all traffic already in the roundabout before entering. If you miss your exit, continue around until you return to it. Signal when you change lanes or exit.

questionText: Highway construction maintenance signs are:
explanation: Orange signs are used for highway construction and maintenance zones to warn drivers of workers and work zones ahead.

questionText: When approaching a 'T' intersection, who has the right-of-way?
answerC: The traffic going straight through the intersection.
explanation: At T intersections without STOP or YIELD signs, vehicles, bicyclists, and pedestrians on the through road (continuing to go straight) have the right-of-way.

questionText: If you are involved in an accident, you must report the accident to the DMV if:
answerB: Any vehicle caused more than $1,000 in property damage.
explanation: You must report a collision to DMV within 10 days if the collision caused more than $1,000 in property damage or if anyone was injured or killed, even if the injuries were minor.

questionText: When passing a bicycle, you should:
answerA: Honk your horn to let them know you're there.
answerC: Give the bicycle at least three feet of clearance.
explanation: When you cannot change lanes to pass a bicyclist, allow at least three feet between your vehicle and the bicyclist. If you cannot give three feet of space, do not pass until three feet of clearance can be given.

questionText: When driving near road construction zones, you should:
answerA: Pass the zone as quickly as possible to get out of the way.
answerB: Slow down and watch out for workers.
answerC: Stay alert and watch for construction zone signs.
answerD: Increase your speed so as not to impede traffic flow.
explanation: Go through work zones carefully by slowing down and watching for workers. You will see warning signs and message boards when there are workers, slow-moving equipment, and closed lanes ahead.

questionText: If you have concerns that someone you know is no longer capable of driving safely, you should:
answerA: Take away their driver's license and hide it.
answerC: Submit a Request for Driver Reexamination to the DMV.
explanation: DMV has a process to request reexamination of potentially unsafe drivers. You can submit a Request for Driver Reexamination to report concerns about a driver's ability to safely operate a vehicle.

questionText: You will have your driver's license suspended if you obtain _____ in point totals.
explanation: As an adult, your license may be suspended if your driver's record shows any of these point totals: 4 points in 12 months, 6 points in 24 months, or 8 points in 36 months.

questionText: You should check the area behind you before:
explanation: Always check behind you before pulling into a parking spot, turning into a driveway, pulling away from a curb, or performing any backward or departure maneuver to ensure the area is clear.

questionText: The hand signal you can use to indicate you're making a left turn (if your turn signal is not working) is to:
answerA: Make a right angle with your left arm with your fingers pointing towards the sky.
answerB: Make a right angle with your left arm with your fingers pointing down towards the ground.
answerC: Extend your left arm out straight to the left.
answerD: Hand signals are illegal when driving.
explanation: To signal a left turn with your arm, extend your left arm straight out to the left. Use hand-and-arm signals when your vehicle's signal lights are not functioning or when bright sunlight makes them hard to see.

questionText: When parallel parking, the first maneuver you should perform after finding a parking space, is to:
answerC: Position your vehicle alongside the vehicle in front of the space.
explanation: To parallel park, first find a space at least three feet longer than your vehicle. When you find a space, turn on your signal and pull up alongside the vehicle in front of the space, leaving about two feet between vehicles.

questionText: When preparing to make a left turn:
answerA: Look left-right-left and begin your turn when safe.
answerB: Take the turn at full speed, you have the right-of-way.
answerC: Honk your horn to indicate you're turning.
answerD: Stop and wait until no other cars are present.
explanation: When making a left turn, look both ways (left-right-left) and begin your turn when it is safe. This ensures the intersection is clear before proceeding with your turn.

questionText: It is against the law to follow within ____ feet of any fire engine, law enforcement vehicle, ambulance, or other emergency vehicles:
explanation: It is against the law to follow within 300 feet of any fire engine, law enforcement vehicle, ambulance, or other emergency vehicle when their siren or flashing lights are on.

questionText: In California, you are never permitted to drive faster than conditions permit. This is known as the _____ Law:
explanation: The Basic Speed Law states that you may never drive faster than is safe for current road conditions, regardless of the posted speed limit. Your speed should depend on road conditions, traffic, weather, and visibility.

questionText: What is the penalty if you are convicted of driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs?
answerB: Suspended license, required to complete a DUI program, and a fine or fees.
answerD: A warning on your driving record.
explanation: If convicted of DUI, DMV will suspend or revoke your driving privilege for one year. You must complete a DUI program, file proof of insurance (SR 22/SR 1P), and pay reissue or restriction fees. You may also face jail time and fines.

questionText: If you are towing a vehicle or trailer, you must drive in the:
explanation: You must drive in the far-right lane or a lane marked for slower vehicles when you tow a vehicle or trailer, or drive a truck with three or more axles.

questionText: You must notify the DMV within 10 days if you:
answerD: Paint your car a new color.
explanation: If you move, you must notify DMV of your new address within ten days. You can submit a change of address online or by mail. Note: When you sell a vehicle, you must notify DMV within five days.

questionText: Carpool Lanes, also known as HOV lanes, are marked by what symbol?
explanation: The road surface in an HOV (High Occupancy Vehicle) lane is marked with a white diamond symbol and the words Carpool Lane to identify lanes reserved for carpools, buses, motorcycles, or low-emission vehicles.

questionText: Which curb color is used to indicate a load and unloading zone?
answerA: A curb with no color marking.
explanation: Yellow curbs are designated for loading and unloading passengers and freight. Do not stop longer than the time posted. If you drive a noncommercial vehicle, you are usually required to stay with your vehicle.

questionText: If five or more vehicles are following you on a narrow two-lane road:
answerA: Move to the right side of your lane and drive slower.
answerB: Continue at a slow speed until they all pass.
answerC: Speed up to create distance between you and the following vehicles.
answerD: Pull off to a turnout lane and allow them to pass.
explanation: You must use a turnout area or lane to let other vehicles pass when you are driving slowly on a two-lane road, where passing is unsafe, and there are five or more vehicles following you.

questionText: A yellow diamond-shaped sign with a traffic signal symbol on it is indicating:
explanation: Yellow diamond-shaped signs warn you of specific road conditions and dangers ahead. A traffic signal symbol on a yellow diamond sign alerts you that there is a traffic signal ahead.

questionText: To help manage sun glare, you should:
answerA: Follow closely behind vehicles to better see them.
answerB: Drive closer to sunrise and sunset.
explanation: Wearing polarized sunglasses helps reduce glare and improve visibility when driving. This is especially helpful during sunrise and sunset when sun glare is most intense.

questionText: Which of these is a legal U-turn?
answerA: Over two sets of double yellow lines in the roadway.
answerB: 200 feet away from a hill or curve.
answerC: Where there is a 'No U-Turn' sign.
answerD: In the residential district, where there is no approaching traffic within 200 feet.
explanation: You may make a U-turn in a residential district if no vehicles are approaching you within 200 feet and there is no sign prohibiting it. Never make a U-turn when you cannot see clearly for 200 feet in each direction.

questionText: What should you do if your vehicle stalls on railroad tracks?
answerA: Turn your emergency flashers on to warn approaching traffic.
answerB: Check left and right; if no trains are coming, call 911.
answerC: Immediately exit your vehicle and clear the tracks. Call 911.
answerD: Turn on your emergency flashers. Call 911.
explanation: If your vehicle stalls on railroad tracks with a train approaching, immediately exit your vehicle and run away from the tracks diagonally in the direction the train is coming from. Then call 911. Do not stay in or near your vehicle.

questionText: The most common cause of collisions is:
explanation: The most common causes of collisions include driver distractions, unsafe speed, improper turns, not following right-of-way rules, not following stop signals and signs, and driving on the wrong side of the road.

questionText: What is the purpose of lane markings on roads?
answerB: To guide drivers on which part of the road to use and understand traffic rules
explanation: Lane markings on road surfaces help drivers know which part of the road to use and understand traffic rules.

questionText: What is a U-turn?
answerD: Turning your vehicle around to go back in the direction you came
explanation: A U-turn is when you turn your vehicle around to go back in the direction you came.

questionText: Motorcyclists are hard to see on the road because:
explanation: Motorcycles are smaller in size and harder to see so they easily disappear in vehicle blind spots.

questionText: Bicyclists have the same rights and responsibilities as:
explanation: Bicyclists have the same rights and responsibilities as other drivers.

questionText: The main source of distracted driving is:
explanation: Cell phones are the main source of distracted driving. Driving while using a handheld cell phone is unsafe and illegal.

questionText: If convicted of a DUI, which of these might you be required to install on your vehicle?
explanation: If convicted of a DUI, you may be required to install an ignition interlock device (IID) on your vehicle.

questionText: If you are in a collision, what must you show to the other drivers involved?
answerB: Your driver's license, vehicle registration card, insurance information, and current address
explanation: You must show your driver's license, vehicle registration card, insurance information, and current address to the other driver, law enforcement officer, and anyone else involved in the collision.

questionText: When you see a flashing yellow arrow, you:
answerB: Can turn after yielding to oncoming traffic and proceed with caution
explanation: A flashing yellow arrow means you can turn, but your turn is not protected from other traffic. Proceed to turn left after yielding to oncoming traffic and proceed with caution.

questionText: The WALK or Walking Person pedestrian signal indicates:
answerC: The signal is about to change
answerD: The numbers count down for crossing
explanation: The WALK or Walking Person pedestrian signal indicates you may cross the street.

questionText: What's the safe following distance during ideal conditions?
explanation: Use the three-second rule to ensure a safe following distance. When the vehicle in front of you passes a certain point, count three seconds. If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

questionText: Which of the following is NOT a restriction that DMV might impose on a driver's license?
answerB: Requiring eyeglasses or corrective contact lenses
answerD: Requiring special mechanical devices on their vehicle

questionText: When can you pass over double solid yellow lines?
answerB: If you are turning left across a single set of double yellow lines to enter or exit a driveway or private road or make a U-turn

questionText: What might DMV do if a driver's physical or mental condition presents an immediate threat to public safety?
answerC: Immediately suspend or revoke the driving privilege
answerD: Require the driver to take a driving course

questionText: Vehicles registered in California must meet which of the following requirements?
What should you do if you are involved in a collision and no one is hurt?
answerB: Stay in the middle of the road
answerC: Move your vehicle out of traffic and then call 911
answerD: Wait for other drivers to move first

questionText: At a 'T' intersection where you are turning from a one-way street onto a two-way street, which of the following is true?
answerB: Traffic turning at the intersection has the right-of-way
answerC: You may turn either right or left from the center lane, but traffic going straight through has the right-of-way
answerD: You can only turn left from the center lane

questionText: What does a broken yellow line indicate?
answerC: You may pass if it's next to your driving lane and safe

questionText: What happens when a referral for someone with a mild cognitive impairment is received by the DMV?
answerB: The Driver Safety team will schedule a reexamination
answerC: They are required to take a vision test only

questionText: If your vehicle hits a parked car, and you cannot find the owner, what should you do?
answerB: Wait for the owner to return
answerC: Leave a note with your name, phone number, and address and report the collision to law enforcement
answerD: Take a photo and drive away

questionText: If stuck in snow or mud, your first step should be to:
answerB: Shift into a low gear and keep the front wheels straight

questionText: In which condition must you turn on your low-beam headlights?
answerB: When using windshield wipers due to fog, rain, or snow

questionText: The 5-sided sign indicates:
If you injure or kill an animal with your vehicle, who should you call?
answerC: The nearest humane society or law enforcement

questionText: A provisional driver cannot drive with passengers under ____ years of age unless a parent, guardian, or other CA-licensed driver, at least 25 years old, rides with them.
What is illegal to wear in both ears while driving?
Before you begin your behind-the-wheel test, you may be asked to locate the
explanation: Before your behind-the-wheel test begins, the DMV examiner will ask you to locate and demonstrate various vehicle components including the windshield, brake lights, tires, rearview mirrors, horn, emergency brake, turn signals, and windshield wipers. This ensures your vehicle is safe to drive for the test.

questionText: What remains on your driving record for 10 years?
explanation: All DUI convictions remain on your driver's record for 10 years. If you get any other DUIs during that time, the court or DMV may give you an additional penalty. Traffic convictions and collisions typically stay on your record for 36 months.

questionText: Which gas is released from a vehicle's exhaust pipe and is deadly and odorless?
explanation: All gas-powered vehicles produce carbon monoxide, which is a deadly odorless gas released from a vehicle's exhaust pipe. Never start your vehicle inside the garage with the door closed. Symptoms include tiredness, yawning, dizziness, nausea, headache, and ringing in the ears.

questionText: If you see a sign with a picture of an animal, you should:
answerC: Watch for animals on or near the road
explanation: If you see a sign with a picture of an animal, watch for animals on or near the road. If you see animals or livestock near the road, slow down or stop and proceed when it is safe. Be sure to follow directions from the person in charge of the animals.

questionText: What can law enforcement ask you to take if they suspect DUI?
explanation: When you drive in California, you consent to a breath, blood, or urine test if a law enforcement officer suspects you of DUI. If you agreed to take a preliminary alcohol screening (PAS) or breath test, you may still be required to take a blood or urine test to detect the presence of drugs.

questionText: If you refuse a breath, blood, or urine test when suspected of DUI, what can DMV do?
answerC: Suspend or revoke your driving privilege
explanation: If a law enforcement officer thinks you are driving while under the influence of drugs or alcohol, they have the right to ask you to take a blood or urine test. If you refuse to take one, DMV will suspend or revoke your driving privilege for one year.

questionText: Before changing lanes, what should you NOT do?
answerD: Let the vehicle drift into another lane
explanation: Before changing lanes, you should signal, check your mirrors, check traffic behind and beside you, look over your shoulder, and check your blind spots. Do not let the vehicle drift into another lane. It is not necessary to slow down before a lane change.

questionText: When must you have proof of financial responsibility (insurance)?
answerB: Only when involved in a collision
answerC: Both when you drive and for a drive test
explanation: You must have your proof of financial responsibility (insurance) when you drive and for a drive test. If you get into a collision, you must show proof to the other drivers involved in the collision.

questionText: When might the DMV impose restrictions on a driver's license?
answerB: When a driver moves to California
answerC: To ensure a driver operates within their ability
answerD: When a driver buys a new vehicle
explanation: DMV places restrictions on a driver's license to ensure a driver is operating a vehicle within their ability. Restrictions may be imposed by DMV or required by law. Restrictions placed on your driving privilege will be reasonable and necessary for your safety and the safety of others.

questionText: Where should you never park?
answerA: On a marked or unmarked crosswalk
explanation: Never park or leave your vehicle on a marked or unmarked crosswalk. This is illegal and dangerous for pedestrians. Other illegal parking locations include sidewalks, in front of driveways, within 15 feet of a fire hydrant, and in tunnels or on bridges unless permitted by signs.

questionText: What does a red-painted curb indicate?
explanation: A red-painted curb means no stopping, standing, or parking. Buses may stop at a red zone marked for buses only. Other colored curbs have different meanings: white is for passenger loading/unloading, green is limited time parking, yellow is for loading passengers and freight, and blue is for disabled parking.

questionText: In the Hand-to-Hand Steering method, where should your hands start?
explanation: To use the Hand-to-Hand Steering (Push/Pull) method, start with your hands at 9 and 3 o'clock or 8 and 4 o'clock. Do not cross your hands over the middle of the steering wheel. Keep your hands in these positions, even when making turns.

questionText: Which lane is reserved for carpools, buses, and motorcycles?
explanation: An HOV (High-Occupancy Vehicle) lane is a special lane reserved for carpools, buses, motorcycles, or low-emission vehicles with decals. The road surface in an HOV lane is marked with a diamond symbol and the words Carpool Lane. Road signs list the hours when the HOV rules apply.

questionText: When backing up in a straight line, what should you do first?
answerA: Observe traffic and check appropriate blind spots
explanation: To back up in a straight line, first do a traffic check by observing traffic and checking appropriate blind spots. Then signal, check your blind spots again by looking in your rearview mirror and over your shoulder for approaching vehicles and pedestrians, before beginning to back up.

questionText: Every vehicle has blind spots usually located:
answerA: Directly in front of the driver
answerC: At the sides slightly behind the driver
explanation: Every vehicle has blind spots. These are areas around the vehicle that a driver cannot see when looking straight ahead or using the mirrors. For most vehicles, the blind spots are at the sides, slightly behind the driver. Check your blind spots by looking over your right and left shoulders before changing lanes, turning, merging, or backing up.

questionText: What program might you be eligible for if you cannot afford liability insurance?
answerA: California High Cost Automobile Insurance Program
answerB: California No Cost Automobile Insurance Program
answerC: California Low Cost Automobile Insurance Program
explanation: If you cannot afford liability insurance, you may be eligible for the California Low Cost Automobile Insurance Program. For more information, visit mylowcostauto.com or call 1-866-602-8861.

questionText: If a motorist is caught driving behind a school bus with flashing red lights, they can be fined up to:
explanation: When a school bus flashes red lights (located at the top, front, and back of the bus), you must stop from either direction until the children are safely across the street and the lights stop flashing. If you fail to stop, you may be fined up to $1,000 and your driving privilege could be suspended for one year.

questionText: If you are 13 to 20 years old and convicted of operating a bicycle under the influence, your driving privilege may
answerC: Be suspended or delayed for one year once eligible
explanation: If you are 13 to 20 years old and convicted of operating a bicycle while under the influence of alcohol or drugs, your driving privilege may be suspended or delayed for one year once you are eligible to drive.

questionText: When should you use your emergency flashers?
answerA: When you see a collision or hazard ahead
answerC: When the car's music system is on
explanation: If you can see a collision or hazard ahead, warn drivers behind you by turning on your emergency flashers, lightly tapping your brake pedal three or four times, or using a hand signal when slowing and stopping. Also use emergency flashers if you need to stop because of vehicle trouble.

questionText: Within how many hours must you report a collision to law enforcement if someone is injured or killed?
explanation: You must make a report to law enforcement within 24 hours of the collision if anyone is injured or killed. Your insurance agent, broker, or legal representative can also file the report. You must also report the collision to DMV within 10 days.

questionText: When at a traffic signal or sign, you should yield to:
answerA: Pedestrians, bicyclists, and nearby vehicles that have the right-of-way
explanation: When at or approaching traffic signals or signs, yield to pedestrians, bicyclists, and other nearby vehicles that may have the right-of-way. Never assume that other drivers will give you the right-of-way. Give up your right-of-way when it will help prevent collisions.

questionText: In extreme heat, you should turn off:
explanation: In extreme heat, you should watch the temperature gauge, avoid driving at high speeds for long periods, and turn off the air conditioner. See your vehicle owner's manual for more information about managing overheating conditions.

questionText: What does a solid green light indicate at an intersection?
answerA: You must stop and wait for the light to turn yellow
answerC: You may go through the intersection if the way is clear
explanation: A green traffic signal light means GO. You should still stop for any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian in the intersection. Only proceed if you have enough space without creating a danger to any oncoming vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian. Do not enter the intersection if you cannot get completely across before the traffic signal light turns red.

questionText: The Mature Driver Improvement Program is designed for drivers how old and above?
explanation: The Mature Driver Improvement Program is an eight-hour course for drivers 55 years old and older. It covers a range of topics that are of special interest to mature drivers. Your insurance company may offer discounts if you complete the program.

questionText: What should you do if your vehicle becomes disabled on the freeway?
answerA: Stay in the vehicle and wait for help with your seat belt on
answerC: Try to repair the vehicle in the middle of the freeway
answerD: Flag down passing vehicles for assistance
explanation: If your vehicle stops working on the freeway, safely pull over to the right shoulder, exit on the right side if you must get out, dial 511 or locate a call box for assistance, return to your vehicle from the right side, and stay inside your vehicle with your seat belt on until help arrives. Use your emergency flashers at your discretion.

questionText: What can be the basis for a reexamination by the DMV?
answerC: The school district the driver lives in
explanation: A physical or mental condition or poor driver's record can be the basis for a reexamination, not a driver's age.

questionText: Which form should be completed when selling a vehicle?
answerB: Notice of Priority Reexamination of Driver
answerC: Notice of Transfer and Release of Liability
explanation: When you sell a vehicle, you must notify DMV within five days by completing a Notice of Transfer and Release of Liability.

questionText: Where should you not stop your vehicle?
answerC: Just over a hill or just around a curve
explanation: Do not stop just over a hill or just around a curve. Other drivers may not see your vehicle in time to avoid a collision.

questionText: What is the minimum insurance coverage required for property damage?
explanation: Your insurance must cover at least $15,000 for property damage.

questionText: What should you do when driving in a lane marked with large broken lines on a freeway or street?
answerA: Increase your speed and continue in the same lane
answerB: Be prepared to exit the freeway or merge, as the lane may be ending
answerC: Ignore the markings and maintain your current driving pattern
answerD: Change lanes immediately without checking for signs
explanation: Ending freeway and street lanes are usually marked with large broken lines. If you are driving in a lane marked with broken lines, be prepared to exit the freeway or for the lane to end. Look for a sign that tells you to exit or merge.

questionText: What will happen to your driving privilege if you are in a collision without proper insurance coverage?
answerB: It will be suspended for up to four years
answerC: You will be given a warning
explanation: Your driving privilege will be suspended for up to four years if you are in a collision and do not have proper insurance coverage. It does not matter who was at fault.

questionText: If you are driving a low- or zero-emissions vehicle, you are allowed to drive in the HOV lane as long as
answerA: No other vehicles are in that lane
answerB: Your vehicle has a special DMV-issued decal
explanation: You are driving a low emission or zero emission vehicle and you must display a special DMV-issued decal to use an HOV lane.

questionText: When making a left turn from a two-way street, where should you start and end your turn?
answerA: Start in the right lane and end in the left lane
answerB: Start and end the turn in the right lane closest to the middle of the street
answerC: Start in the left lane and end in any available lane
answerD: Start and end the turn in the left lane closest to the middle of the street
explanation: Start the turn in the left lane closest to the middle of the street. To reduce the risk of collision, end the turn in the left lane closest to the middle of the street going in your vehicle's direction.

questionText: What is lane splitting?
answerB: Motorcycles sharing lanes with other vehicles
explanation: It is legal to share lanes with motorcycles. This is known as lane splitting.

questionText: In California, how many days do you have to transfer vehicle ownership to your name after purchasing it?
explanation: When you buy a vehicle, you have 10 days to transfer ownership to your name.

questionText: What might the DMV issue if they decide to allow you to continue driving after a reexamination?
explanation: DMV may issue you a limited term driver's license after a reexamination if they decide to allow you to continue driving.

questionText: A diamond-shaped sign on a truck means:
answerB: The truck is carrying hazardous loads
answerD: The truck is carrying perishable goods
explanation: A diamond-shaped sign on a truck means that the truck's load may be dangerous (gas, explosives, etc.). Vehicles with these signs must stop before crossing railroad tracks.

questionText: If DMV requires a reexamination, which of these might they do?
answerB: Conduct an over the telephone reexamination
answerD: Require you to pay a fine
explanation: DMV may conduct an in-person or over the telephone reexamination as part of the reexamination process.

questionText: A single solid white line marks what?
answerA: Traffic lanes going in opposite directions
answerB: Traffic lanes going in the same direction
explanation: A single solid white line marks traffic lanes going in the same direction. This includes one-way streets.

questionText: A yellow and black circular or x-shaped sign warns of:
explanation: A yellow and black circular sign or X-shaped sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing. Look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Let any trains pass before you proceed.

questionText: What does a single solid yellow line mark?
answerB: The center of a road with two-way traffic
explanation: A single solid yellow line marks the center of a road with two-way traffic. Do not pass a vehicle in front of you if there is only one lane of traffic going your direction and a solid yellow line on your side of the road.

questionText: Which substances are covered by California's DUI laws?
explanation: California's driving under the influence (DUI) laws apply to both alcohol and drugs. It is illegal to drive while under the influence of alcohol or any drug that affects your ability to drive safely.

questionText: If you fail a DMV vision test, you will be asked to have your eye doctor complete which form?
explanation: If you do not pass your vision test, you will be asked to have your eye doctor complete a Report of Vision Examination (DL 62) form.

questionText: Which of the following is true regarding medication labels?
answerC: They do not provide any useful information
answerD: You should read them and know the effects of the drug
explanation: Prescription and over-the-counter medications can make you an unsafe driver. It is your responsibility to know the effects of the medications you take. Make sure you read medication labels and know the effects of any drug you use.

questionText: What medical condition might physicians report to the DMV?
explanation: Physicians are required to report patients, who are at least 14 years old, to DMV for medical conditions that may affect your ability to drive safely, such as lapse of consciousness.

questionText: What should you do if you encounter high winds while driving?
answerC: Maintain a firm hand position on the steering wheel
explanation: When driving in high winds, maintain a firm hand position on the steering wheel. Strong wind gusts are unpredictable. If you are not holding the wheel properly and a gust hits, you can lose control of the vehicle.

questionText: A skid caused by braking too hard is known as:
explanation: A locked wheel skid is usually caused by braking too hard when you are going too fast. If this happens, your vehicle will skid no matter which way the steering wheel is turned.

questionText: What is the minimum insurance coverage required for a single death or injury?
explanation: Your insurance must cover at least $30,000 for a single death or injury.

questionText: When is it illegal to drive using only parking lights?
explanation: It is illegal to drive using only parking lights. You must use your headlights when required by law.

questionText: Why is vision crucial for driving?
answerC: To notice hazards, judge distances, and read road signs
answerD: To avoid getting sun in your eyes
explanation: You must be able to notice hazards in different types of lighting, judge distances, adjust to traffic speed, and read road signs. Vision is essential for safe driving.

questionText: How long do you have to register your out-of-state vehicle after getting a job in California?
explanation: You have 20 days to register your vehicle after you become a resident or get a job in California.

questionText: What are turnout areas or lanes used for?
explanation: Turnout areas or lanes are special areas on two-lane roads where you merge to allow cars behind you to pass. You must use a turnout area or lane when you are driving slowly on a two-lane road, where passing is unsafe, and there are five or more vehicles following you.

questionText: What should you do if you're concerned about your driving skills?
answerB: Ask a trusted driver to observe your driving
explanation: If you are concerned about your driving, ask a trusted driver with a valid driver's license to sit in the passenger seat and observe your driving. Your observer should note any dangerous driving behaviors and give suggestions for improvement.

questionText: On a multilane road, which lane is used to pass other vehicles?
explanation: On a multilane road, the passing lane (far left lane) is the lane closest to the center divider and is used to pass other vehicles.

questionText: Who can refer a driver for a reexamination to the DMV?
answerC: A physician, law enforcement, or family member
explanation: Drivers with a physical or mental condition can be referred to DMV by a physician, law enforcement, or family member by submitting a completed Request for Driver Reexamination form.

questionText: If DMV decides to reexamine a driver, which test(s) might they require the driver to take?
explanation: DMV may require you to take a knowledge, vision, or driving test(s) during a reexamination.

questionText: What is the left (or fast) lane often referred to?
explanation: Traffic lanes are often referred to by number. The left (or fast) lane is called the Number 1 Lane. The lane to the right of the Number 1 Lane is called the Number 2 Lane, then the Number 3 Lane, etc.

questionText: It is okay to park your vehicle in a public transit bus lane provided the following is true:
answerA: It is always illegal to park in a public transit bus lane
answerB: The vehicle is parked for ten minutes or less
answerC: There are no buses coming down the street
answerD: You are picking up a bus passenger
explanation: It is illegal to drive, stop, park, or leave a vehicle in an area designated for public transit buses. However, you may cross a bus lane to make a right turn.

questionText: What should you never do when merging onto a highway?
answerA: Use your mirrors and turn signals
answerB: Leave three seconds of space between you and the vehicle ahead of you
explanation: When merging onto a highway, make sure you do not cross over any solid lines. If you need to cross several lanes, signal and cross them one at a time.

questionText: What is one situation that may require one-hand steering?
explanation: There are only two situations that may require steering with one hand: when you are turning while backing up to see where you are going behind you (place your hand at the 12 o'clock position), or when you are operating vehicle controls that require you to remove a hand from the steering wheel.

questionText: When your vehicle stalls or stops while blocking part of a train track with a train approaching, you should:
answerA: Try to restart the vehicle immediately
answerB: Stay inside the vehicle and wait for help
answerC: Exit your vehicle and run away from the tracks diagonally in the direction the train is coming from
answerD: Wave to the train driver to stop
explanation: If your vehicle stalls or stops while blocking part of a train track with a train approaching and warning lights flashing, immediately exit your vehicle and run away from the tracks diagonally in the direction the train is coming from. Then call 911.

questionText: In a blind intersection, the speed limit is:
explanation: An intersection is considered blind if it has no stop signs at any corner. The speed limit for a blind intersection is 15 mph.

questionText: When sharing the road with light rail vehicles it's important to:
answerB: Never turn in front of them
answerC: Be aware of where they operate
explanation: To safely share the road with light rail vehicles: be aware of where they operate, never turn in front of an approaching light rail vehicle, maintain a safe distance, and check for approaching light rail vehicles before you turn across the tracks.

questionText: What does it mean when you see a sign that says 'NEV ROUTE'?
explanation: Signs marked 'NEV USE ONLY' or 'NEV ROUTE' indicate you should watch for slow-moving vehicles. Neighborhood Electric Vehicles (NEVs) and Low-speed Vehicles (LSVs) reach a maximum speed of 25 mph.

questionText: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in a Business District is:
explanation: The speed limit in business or residential districts is 25 mph, unless otherwise posted.

questionText: A solid red traffic signal light signifies:
explanation: A red traffic signal light means STOP. You can turn right at a red light after a complete stop unless there is a NO TURN ON RED sign posted.

questionText: Where should open containers of alcohol be kept in a vehicle?
answerC: In the trunk or where passengers do not sit
explanation: If you are carrying alcohol or cannabis in your vehicle, the container must be sealed and unopened. If it is open, you must keep the container in the trunk or place where passengers do not sit. It is also illegal to keep an open container of alcohol in your glove box.

questionText: What is it called when you fail to stop or leave the scene of an accident?
explanation: Failing to stop or leaving the scene of an accident is called a hit-and-run. The punishment is severe if you are convicted of a hit-and-run.

questionText: Who takes on the financial responsibility for drivers younger than 18 years old?
explanation: Parents or guardians take on financial responsibility for drivers younger than 18 years old and pay for damages if the driver is involved in a collision. Drivers who are 18 years old and older take on their own financial responsibility.

questionText: What happens if you agree to take a preliminary alcohol screening (PAS) or breath test?
answerA: You may still be required to take a blood or urine test to detect the presence of drugs
answerD: You will be given a certificate
explanation: If you agreed to take a preliminary alcohol screening (PAS) or breath test, you may still be required to take a blood or urine test to detect the presence of drugs.

questionText: The speed limit within 500 feet of a school while children are outside is:
answerD: 25 mph (or as low as 15 mph in some school zones)
explanation: The speed limit is 25 mph within 500 feet of a school while children are outside or crossing the street. Some school zones may have speed limits as low as 15 mph.

questionText: When parking on a downhill slope with a curb, where should the front wheels point?
explanation: When parking headed downhill, turn your front wheels toward the curb or right toward the side of the road.

questionText: How far must you stop from a railroad crossing if the crossing devices or a person warns you a train is coming?
explanation: When the crossing devices or a person warns you a train is coming, stop at least 15 feet from the nearest track.

questionText: What is a center left turn lane used for?
answerC: Preparing for and making a left turn or U-turn
explanation: A center left turn lane is located in the middle of a two-way street and is used to prepare for and make a left turn or U-turn. It is not a regular traffic lane or passing lane. You may only drive for 200 feet in the center left turn lane.

questionText: If you are stopped by a law enforcement officer and cited for a traffic violation, you:
answerB: Sign the ticket as a promise to appear in traffic court
answerC: Have to appear in court the next day
explanation: If you are stopped by a law enforcement officer and cited for a traffic violation, you sign the ticket as a promise to appear in traffic court.

questionText: When a railroad crossing is not controlled, what is the speed limit when you are within 100 feet and cannot see for 400 feet in both directions?
explanation: The speed limit is 15 mph within 100 feet of a railroad crossing and you cannot see the tracks for 400 feet in both directions. You may drive faster than 15 mph if the crossing is controlled by gates, a warning signal, or a flagman.

questionText: Which of the following is the proper procedure for parallel parking?
answerA: Drive forward into the space without stopping
answerB: Stop next to the vehicle behind the open space, and then drive forward into the space
answerC: Stop next to the vehicle in front of the open space, and then back into the space
explanation: To parallel park, pull up alongside the vehicle in front of the space, leaving about two feet between vehicles. Stop once your rear bumper is aligned with the front of your parking space, then begin backing up and turn your steering wheel to back into the space at about a 45-degree angle.

questionText: What speed should you be driving when entering onto a highway?
answerA: At or near the speed of traffic
answerB: Faster than the speed of traffic
answerC: Slower than the speed of traffic
explanation: When you enter a highway, you need to be at or near the speed of traffic. This allows you to safely merge into highway traffic when it is safe to do so without disrupting traffic flow.

questionText: How many feet away should you switch from high beam to low beam headlights when approaching a vehicle coming towards you?
explanation: Dim your high-beam headlights to low beams within 500 feet of a vehicle coming toward you or within 300 feet of a vehicle you are following. This prevents blinding other drivers.

questionText: Who can legally park next to curb painted blue?
answerA: Someone who is either picking up or dropping off passengers at this location
answerB: A person who is disabled and has a special placard or vehicle license plate for disabled persons
answerC: A person who will only be parked at the curb for less than 15 minutes
explanation: Blue curbs are designated for parking for a disabled person or someone driving a disabled person with a special placard or special license plate. This parking is reserved exclusively for individuals with the proper disabled parking credentials.

questionText: What should you do when there is a school bus ahead that starts flashing yellow warning lights?
answerA: Slow down and prepare to stop
answerC: Cautiously pass the school bus on the left
explanation: Some school buses flash yellow lights when preparing to stop to let children off the bus. The yellow flashing lights warn you to slow down and prepare to stop. When the bus flashes red lights, you must stop from either direction until the children are safely across the street and the lights stop flashing.

questionText: Which of the following is a requirement of California's Basic Speed Law?
answerA: Always drive the speed limit, regardless of conditions
answerB: Match your speed to that of your surrounding traffic
answerC: Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions
explanation: In California, you may never drive faster than is safe for the current road conditions. This is known as the Basic Speed Law. Regardless of the posted speed limit, your speed should depend on the number of vehicles on the road, road surface conditions, weather, and the presence of bicyclists or pedestrians.

questionText: You must notify the DMV within 5 days, if you:
answerA: Paint your vehicle a different color
answerB: Sell or transfer ownership of your vehicle
explanation: When you sell a vehicle, you must notify DMV within five days by completing a Notice of Transfer and Release of Liability. This protects you from liability for parking violations or traffic collisions involving the vehicle after the sale.

questionText: Which of the following is an example of a safe driving practice?
answerA: Staring only at the middle of the road
answerB: Always keep your eyes moving to scan the surroundings
answerC: Using your high-beam headlights in the fog
explanation: To give yourself time to react, avoid last minute moves and hazards, always keep your eyes moving and scan the road at least 10 seconds ahead of your vehicle. This helps you be aware of your surroundings and make good decisions to react to hazards on the road.

questionText: What color curb does not allow vehicles to stop or park?
explanation: Red curbs mean no stopping, standing, or parking. Buses may stop at a red zone marked for buses only. This is a strict prohibition for all other vehicles.

questionText: You are required to notify DMV by filing a Report of Traffic Accident Occuring in California (SR-1) form if:
answerB: You were involved in a collision with an injury
answerC: Your vehicle fails a smog test
explanation: If you are in a collision, you must report it to DMV within 10 days if the collision caused more than $1,000 in damage to property or anyone was injured or killed. Each driver must file a Report of Traffic Accident Occurring in California (SR 1) with DMV whether or not you caused the collision.

questionText: What is indicated by two sets of double yellow lines spaced 2 feet or more apart?
answerA: Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction
explanation: Two sets of solid double yellow lines spaced two or more feet apart are considered a barrier. Do not drive on or over this barrier, make a left turn, or make a U-turn across it, except at designated openings.

questionText: What should you do to make a right turn at an upcoming intersection?
answerA: Merge into the bicycle lane before making the turn
answerB: Wait until the bicycle lane ends, then make the turn
answerC: Make the turn from your current lane and do not enter the bicycle lane
explanation: You can drive in a bike lane within 200 feet from the turn when preparing to make a right turn. Check for bicyclists in your blind spots before entering the bike lane.

questionText: A highway has a posted speed limit of 65 mph. What does this mean?
answerA: You must always drive 65 mph on that highway
answerB: You may drive faster only if there are no other vehicles
answerC: You must drive 65 mph only if driving conditions are ideal
explanation: In California, you may never drive faster than is safe for the current road conditions. This is known as the Basic Speed Law. Regardless of the posted speed limit, your speed should depend on road conditions, weather, traffic, and other factors. You should only drive at the posted speed limit when conditions are ideal.

questionText: When is parking in a crosshatched (diagonal lines) area allowed?
answerA: It is never allowed to park in a crosshatched (diagonal lines) area
answerB: If the area is at least twenty feet away from a railroad track
answerC: If the area is labeled as a bicycle lane, unless otherwise posted
explanation: Never park or leave your vehicle in the crosshatched (diagonal lines) area next to a designated disabled parking space. This area is reserved for wheelchair access and vehicle loading equipment.

questionText: What should you do if your cell phone rings and you do not have a hands-free device?
answerA: Answer the call and keep the conversation short
answerB: Do not answer the phone and let it go to voice mail
answerC: Answer the call if you are stopped at a red light
explanation: Do not answer your cell phone if it rings. Let the call go to voicemail. If you must return or make a call, pull safely off the road. Driving while using a handheld cell phone is unsafe and illegal.

questionText: If a traffic signal is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, what should you do?
answerA: Partially enter the intersection, as allowed by traffic
answerB: Wait and do not enter the intersection until your vehicle can get completely across
answerC: Drive around the traffic on the shoulder to help ease the congestion
explanation: Even if you have a green light, do not start across the intersection if there are pedestrians or vehicles blocking your pathway. Wait until the intersection is clear and your vehicle can get completely across.

questionText: In which lane should you end your turn when making a right turn?
answerB: The lane closest to the left edge of the road
answerC: The lane closest to the right edge of the road
explanation: Complete your turn in the right lane. Do not turn wide into another lane. This ensures safe and predictable movement for all road users.

questionText: When is it required for you to obey directions from a crossing guard?
answerC: Only when children are present in front of a school
explanation: When near schools, be sure to obey school safety patrols or crossing guards' directions at all times. Their instructions take priority to ensure the safety of pedestrians, especially children.

questionText: What should you do when reaching an intersection where a person operating a motorized wheelchair has entered the crosswalk?
answerA: Remain stopped behind the crosswalk line until the motorized wheelchair has safely finished crossing
answerB: Remain stopped behind the nearest crosswalk line until the motorized wheelchair is beyond the range of your vehicle
answerC: Assume right-of-way if the motorized wheelchair stops in the crosswalk
explanation: A person with a disability using a tricycle, quadricycle, or wheelchair for transportation is considered a pedestrian. When there is a pedestrian crossing a roadway with or without a crosswalk, you must use caution, reduce your speed, or stop to allow the pedestrian to safely finish crossing. If there is a limit line before the crosswalk, stop at the limit line and allow pedestrians to cross the street.

questionText: Which of the following is true about large trucks?
answerA: They are made of many trailers, which make them more maneuverable than passenger vehicles
answerB: They have large blind spots, which makes it difficult for the truck driver to see other vehicles
answerC: They have large and powerful emergency brakes, which gives them the capability to stop quickly
explanation: Large vehicle and truck drivers have a better view in front of them and bigger mirrors. But they also have large blind spots, also called No Zones. In these areas, your vehicle can disappear from a large vehicle or truck driver's view. If you cannot see the truck's side mirrors, the truck driver cannot see you.

questionText: What is one of the most common causes of traffic collisions?
explanation: The most common causes of collisions include driver distractions, unsafe speed, improper turns, not following the right-of-way rules, not following stop signals and signs, driving on the wrong side of the road, and a vehicle traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.

questionText: Any driver who willfully flees or attempts to evade law enforcement, during which a person is seriously injured, is subject to:
answerA: Imprisonment in a state prison for up to seven years
